bibl.title: Amphorae from the Red Sea and Their Contribution to the Interpretation of Late Roman Trade beyond the Empire. Avec résumé en anglais.

series.title: Monographs of the Danish Institute at Athens.

bibl.note: Introduction: The Red Sea and Indo-Roman Trade. - The Red Sea Sites. - Red Sea Culture. - Early Red Sea Culture. - Late Red Sea Culture. - Indian Finds from the Red Sea. - Beyond the Red Sea. - Summary. - P. 399: Interaction between Axum and Berenice / Myos Hormos is indicated by finds of early Axumite-style pottery at both Roman sites and an ostracon from Myos Hormos (O. 543) referring to the Troglodytes.

bibl.title: Transport Amphorae and Trade in the Eastern Mediterranean. Acts of the International Colloquium at the Danish Institute at Athens, September 26-29, 2002

bibl.seg: TOMBER Roberta, Amphorae from the Red Sea and Their Contribution to the Interpretation of Late Roman Trade beyond the Empire. Avec résumé en anglais.

Jonas EIRING and John LUND (Edd.), Transport Amphorae and Trade in the Eastern Mediterranean. Acts of the International Colloquium at the Danish Institute at Athens, September 26-29, 2002 = Monographs of the Danish Institute at Athens. 5 (Athens - Aarhus, 2004) pp. 393-402, 3 figg.

Introduction: The Red Sea and Indo-Roman Trade. - The Red Sea Sites. - Red Sea Culture. - Early Red Sea Culture. - Late Red Sea Culture. - Indian Finds from the Red Sea. - Beyond the Red Sea. - Summary. - P. 399: Interaction between Axum and Berenice / Myos Hormos is indicated by finds of early Axumite-style pottery at both Roman sites and an ostracon from Myos Hormos (O. 543) referring to the Troglodytes.
